name: Arcamag
description: The Arcamag is a tiny monstrosity with a cunning and deceptive nature, capable of blending in as an ordinary object when motionless. It has exceptional charisma and is adept at manipulating spellcasters through attachment.
memorable: Its ability to shape-shift into small objects and attach itself to spellcasters makes the Arcamag a unique and intriguing threat.
goals: Often focuses on manipulating spellcasters and can significantly impact their abilities.
relations: Can be found alongside spellcasters and may serve as a nuisance or tactical advantage.
environment: Commonly encountered in areas where spellcasters gather, such as magical academies or enchanted forests.
strengths: Excels in stealth and manipulation, making it difficult to detect and a potent threat to spellcasters.
weaknesses: Low strength and intelligence, making it weak in direct combat situations.
attacks: The Arcamag can perform a melee attack to attach itself to a spellcaster, imposing psychic damage dependence on the target's spellcaster level rather than dealing direct damage.
most_powerful_ability: Shapechanger ability allows it to polymorph into small objects, enhancing its stealth and deceptive capabilities.
skills: The Arcamag has a good stealth skill, making it easy for it to hide from targets.
additional_information: Camouflage ability grants advantage on Stealth checks while attached to a host.
Can teleport once per day to reposition itself.
Psychic damage inflicted on the host upon detachment depends on their spellcaster level.
Remains an ordinary object while motionless, making it hard to identify.
Has an average passive perception score, but relies more on stealth.
test_queries: stealthy creature that attaches to spellcasters
